text: Henry was born early at 26 weeks I was
relieved that he was alive but I didn't
truly understand what having a baby 26
weeks really meant
when I went to the intensive care unit
it was a big shock it was the reality
that I guess I never wanted seeing other
children pathway was a massive reality
to myself and my husband the back could
have been our outcome Emery has been
unwell with his lungs in his heart he
also has a condition called
hydrocephalus which was the main issue
when he was born prematurely when he's
been at the illest we have prepared for
him to only make the night he has spent
all his life in an intensive care
Frankie I've been a social worker for
just over five years love my job I
wasn't aware that when Henry was born it
with instantly kick her off my maternity
leave I took the 12 months that I was
entitled to my maternity leave was
completely taken up in hospital I feel I
use a term slightly robbed of my my
right to spend time with my child at
home but that is my situation and I
can't change it
after parents have spent a period of
time a significant period of time on a
neonatal unit they need time to
emotionally recover from that the way
that it currently is you know no sooner
are they sort of taken out of a
traumatic situation they then have to
face the tour Matt of going back to work
before they've even practically had
their had their child at home oh yeah hi
nice to me I was thinking about it last

own in his buggy was when he was 11
months old the first Pony breathed air

sound really bizarre to a person who is
able to take their car at home security

yeah the normal things that we should be
doing with a child when you have a car
the expectations are gone and so the 12
months that i would have had all I won't
have that opportunity now and now I'm on

horrible that feels horrible why should
I not have that time with my son that
many many parents guess it's been
beautiful in most of the moments but in
the most darkest times it's been
horrendous yeah it's just I can't
survive in any way is literally like a

I've had many conversations with other
parents who have felt I always refer to
it as Rob but who feel that they have
wasted their maternity leave you know
sitting in a hospital staring into an
incubator being kind of a mum because
you're there but you can't really do
anything it's not what being a mum is
about to be able to be a mum and what
you hope to be when you have a child or
get pregnant doesn't really start until
you step out the hospital doors and you
come home and that's why it's so
important that's why this is so
important
